raw_text: The sense annotated corpus required for this task was built using the Open Mind Word Expert system (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002), adapted to Romanian1
clean_text: The sense annotated corpus required for this task was built using the Open Mind Word Expert system (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002), adapted to Romanian.

raw_text: To overcome this limitation, we exploit Wikipedia, a collaboratively generated Web encyclopedia. The use of collaborative contributions from volunteers has been previously shown to be beneficial in the Open Mind Word Expert project (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002)
clean_text: The use of collaborative contributions from volunteers has been previously shown to be beneficial in the Open Mind Word Expert project (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002).

citing_paper_authors: Rada, Mihalcea | Timothy, Chklovski | Adam, Kilgarriff
raw_text: Volunteer Contributions over the Web The sense annotated corpus required for this task was built using the Open Mind Word Expert system (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) 1
clean_text: Volunteer Contributions over the Web The sense annotated corpus required for this task was built using the Open Mind Word Expert system (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002).

citing_paper_authors: Hwee Tou, Ng | Yee Seng, Chan
raw_text: Due to the expensive annotation process, only a handful of manually sense-tagged corpora are available. An effort to alleviate the training data bottle neck is the Open Mind Word Expert (OMWE) project (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) to collect sense-tagged data from Internet users
clean_text: Due to the expensive annotation process, only a handful of manually sense-tagged corpora are available. An effort to alleviate the training data bottle neck is the Open Mind Word Expert (OMWE) project (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) to collect sense-tagged data from Internet users.

citing_paper_authors: Timothy, Chklovski | Rada, Mihalcea | Ted, Pedersen | Amruta, Purandare
raw_text: The annotated corpus required for this task was built using the Open Mind Word Expert system (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002), adapted for multilingual annotations 1
clean_text: The annotated corpus required for this task was built using the Open Mind Word Expert system (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002), adapted for multilingual annotations.

raw_text: This method, initially proposed by (Yarowsky, 1995), was successfully evaluated in the context of the SENSEVAL framework (Mihalcea, 2002) .Finally, in an effort related to the Wikipedia collection process, (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) have implemented the Open Mind Word Expert system for collecting sense annotations from volunteer contributors over the Web
clean_text: Finally, in an effort related to the Wikipedia collection process, (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) have implemented the Open Mind Word Expert system for collecting sense annotations from volunteer contributors over the Web.

citing_paper_authors: Roberto, Navigli | Kenneth C., Litkowski | Orin, Hargraves
raw_text: Recent estimations of the inter-annotator agreement when using the WordNet inventory report figures of 72.5% agreement in the preparation of the English all-words test set at Senseval-3 (Snyder and Palmer,2004) and 67.3% on the Open Mind Word Expert an notation exercise (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) .As the inter-annotator agreement is often considered an upper bound for WSD systems, it was desirable to have a much higher number for our task, given its coarse-grained nature
clean_text: Recent estimations of the inter-annotator agreement when using the WordNet inventory report figures of 72.5% agreement in the preparation of the English all-words test set at Senseval-3 (Snyder and Palmer,2004) and 67.3% on the Open Mind Word Expert an notation exercise (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002).

citing_paper_authors: Antonio, Sanfilippo | Stephen, Tratz | Michelle L., Gregory
raw_text: The extension consisted in extending the training data set so as to include a selection of WordNet examples (full sentences containing a main verb) and the Open Mind Word Expert corpus (Chklovski and Mihalcea 2002)
clean_text: The extension consisted in extending the training data set so as to include a selection of WordNet examples (full sentences containing a main verb) and the Open Mind Word Expert corpus (Chklovski and Mihalcea 2002).

citing_paper_authors: Sameer S., Pradhan | Edward, Loper | Dmitriy, Dligach | Martha, Palmer
raw_text: For the fine-grained All Words sense tagging task, which has always used WordNet, the system performance has ranged from our 59% to 65.2 (Senseval3, (Decadt et al, 2004)) to 69% (Seneval2, (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002))
clean_text: For the fine-grained All Words sense tagging task, which has always used WordNet, the system performance has ranged from our 59% to 65.2 (Senseval3, (Decadt et al, 2004)) to 69% (Seneval2, (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002)).

citing_paper_authors: Stephen, Tratz | Antonio, Sanfilippo | Michelle L., Gregory | Alan, Chappell | Christian, Posse | Paul, Whitney
raw_text: We use SemCor1, OMWE 1.0 (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002), and example sentences in Word Net as the training corpus
clean_text: We use SemCor1, OMWE 1.0 (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002), and example sentences in Word Net as the training corpus.

raw_text: Chklovski and Mihalcea (2002) presented another interesting proposal which turns to Web users to produce sense-tagged corpora. Another type of method, which exploits differences between languages, has shown great promise
clean_text: Chklovski and Mihalcea (2002) presented another interesting proposal which turns to Web users to produce sense-tagged corpora.

citing_paper_authors: Jinying, Chen | Andrew, Schein | Lyle H., Ungar | Martha, Palmer
raw_text: Open Mind Word Expert (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) was a real application of active learning for WSD
clean_text: Open Mind Word Expert (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002) was a real application of active learning for WSD.

citing_paper_authors: Liang-Chih, Yu | Chung-Hsien, Wu | Eduard, Hovy
raw_text: Lately, many such corpora have been developed in different languages, including SemCor (Miller et al, 1993), LDC-DSO (Ng and Lee, 1996), Hinoki (Kasahara et al, 2004), and the sense annotated corpora with the help of Web users (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002)
clean_text: Lately, many such corpora have been developed in different languages, including SemCor (Miller et al, 1993), LDC-DSO (Ng and Lee, 1996), Hinoki (Kasahara et al, 2004), and the sense annotated corpora with the help of Web users (Chklovski and Mihalcea, 2002).
